description: The optional `logger` section sets up logging to a console and files.

console.description: Include the console section to enable logging to a standard output, such as a terminal window.

level.description: Select the verbosity level for console logging. Valid options, in decreasing verbosity levels, are `DEBUG`, `INFO`, `WARNING`, `ERROR`, and `CRITICAL`.

file.description: Include the file section to enable logging to a file. The files are rotated daily.

level.description: Select the verbosity level for file logging. Valid options, in decreasing verbosity levels, are `DEBUG`, `INFO`, `WARNING`, `ERROR`, and `CRITICAL`.

path.description: Insert the path to the log file.

retention.description: Specify the number of days to keep logs for.

metrics.description: Enables metrics on the number of log messages recorded per logger and level. This requires `metrics` to be configured as well
